result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Radon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel J. Radon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel J. Radon was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Spend 12 months in the county jail commencing 7/4/15 @ 6pm.  Huber privileges allowed.  Credit for 214 days served.  May not have contact with Nicholas Kolbo, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay prosecution costs in the amount of $70.00.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges allowed.  Credit for 214 days served.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have unsupervised contact with his children, unless otherwise approved by the agent and after completion of batterer's treatment.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Radon

Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Special Prosecutor Lara Parker appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Perwich III.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 540 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.  No unsupervised contact w/his children unless otherwise approved by the agent and after completition of batterers treatment.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Meyer.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 214 days served; deft to report to jail on 7/4/15 at 6pm; pay $250 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs and bond assignment, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
and Order for Other Prosecution Costs - $70.00  kmk

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Meyer.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  Prosecution costs ordered in the amount of $70 (by stipulation of deft).  SEH 6/25/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Meyer.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Meyer reports that the case is resolved.  PLEAH set for 4/23/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
Bond authorized to be released after deducting statutory costs and restitution if any is owed at conclusion of proceedings to Atty. J Ward.  kmk
Atty Meyer is stipulated as counsel for Atty J Ward.
Stipulation for substitution of attorneys.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Matthew Meyer.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Meyer states he just filed a substitution of counsel; states he intends to file a motion for a miranda goodchild hearing.  STC set for 3/13/15 at 11:30am; JS set for 5/26/15 at 9am, pick & to.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Graveley states he is still considering whether or not there will be any changes to the offer.  ADA Ward requests to adjourn trial.  Court removes trial from 2/2/15 at 9am; sets STC for 2/17/15 at 1:30pm to see if there is a resolution and if not will schedule new trial date  Bond continued.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery -filed by ADA, Michael Graveley  kmk

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty J Ward appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Ward's motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  JSH 1/22/15 at 1:15pm and JS 2/2/15 at 9am.
to reduce bond; filed by Atty J Ward.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty John A. Ward.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Pretrial adj. to 9/11/14 at 8:15 to allow def. time to finish the Living Free program in the jail and for Atty Ward to review evidence held at Jt. Services.  Bond continued.

with Michelle/Atty Ward the FPT of 6/26/14 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty Ward is in trial in another branch; reset to 7/14/14 at 8:15am.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward's motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion to modify bond for reasons set forth on the record.  FPT continued to 6/26/14 at 8:30am.
for modification of bond; filed by Atty J Ward.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 5/16/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 5/30/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
